ResourceHeader.Description:
The OV3-3 spacecraft was placed into a polar orbit to measure trapped and precipitating particles and 
                correlated electromagnetic wave fields. The spacecraft was spin stabilized at 8 rpm, and its systems performed 
                well for 14 months, until September 1967 when the onboard tape recorder failed. After that time, low-latitude, 
                real-time tracking continued into 1969 when the spacecraft was deactivated.

OperatingSpan.Note: Exact Stop Date could not be determined.
